snippet: Though the environmentalist Tom Steyer has vowed to sell his investments in companies that generate fossil fuels, the projects his hedge fund bankrolled may emit carbon for decades to come.
abstract: Billionaire Tom Steyer, former hedge fund manager and most influential environmentalist in American politics, has vowed to sell his investments in firms that generate fossil fuels, but examination shows the coal-related projects his fund bankrolled may emit carbon for years; coal-mining companies that received money from Steyer's fund Farallon Capital Management have increased annual production by 70 million tons.

byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO and CORAL DAVENPORT

lead_paragraph: Though the environmentalist Tom Steyer has vowed to sell his investments in companies that generate fossil fuels, the projects his hedge fund bankrolled may emit carbon for decades to come.

headline.main: Aims of Donor Are Shadowed by Past in Coal
